snippet: Most news agencies credited Deron Williams with setting the Nets’ N.B.A. single-game scoring record, but the franchise mark still belongs to Julius Erving.
abstract: Box Seats column notes that most news agencies credited New Jersey Nets guard Deron Williams with setting a team single-game scoring record with 57 points, but the franchise mark still belongs to Julius Erving, who scored a Nets franchise-record 63 points in a single game in 1976.
lead_paragraph: Most news agencies credited Deron Williams with setting the Nets’ N.B.A. single-game scoring record, but the franchise mark still belongs to Julius Erving.

headline.seo: Despite Deron Williams’s Efforts, Dr. J’s Record Still Stands
headline.main: Erving’s Record Forgotten, but Not Gone
headline.print_headline: Erving’s Record Forgotten, but Not Gone
